text:
Blac Chyna knows what she wants for her next relationship.

The 29-year-old model -- who currently has a restraining order against her ex-fiance, Rob Kardashian -- is opening up in a new interview about dating in the future, and says she has a clear set of traits that she's looking for in a partner.

"I would like somebody confident, who takes care of his business, is strong, healthy," she tells Us Weekly. "Somebody that loves their family and treats their friends right -- and treats me right."

WATCH: Blac Chyna's Attorney Calls Restraining Orders Against Rob Kardashian a 'Complete and Total Victory'

Chyna says the number one thing she's looking for is respect.

"Once respect comes, then loves come and when love comes, a really healthy relationship comes, you know?" she notes. "If you don't have that, things just crumble."

In a recent interview with Nightline, Chyna said 30-year-old Kardashian didn't "respect" her, after the reality star posted nude photos of her and accused her of infidelity and doing drugs during their intense social media feud last week.

"The moral of the story is that he doesn’t respect me, so if you can’t respect me, you have to respect the law," Chyna said about taking legal action against Kardashian.

Still, despite all the drama, Chyna says she doesn't plan to take a step back when it comes to social media. However, she is taking "the classier route" when it comes to not responding to online haters.

"I feel like the more I share, the more relatable I am," she tells Us Weekly. "I don't care how somebody looks at me or their feelings. I know how I am. I know how I treat my friends and family and kids and that's all I'm worried about."

"You have some people that's weak and you have some people that's strong," she adds. "I consider myself a very strong person."

Chyna later opens up about her kids -- 4-year-old King, whom she shares with rapper Tyga, and 8-month-old Dream, whom she shares with Kardashian -- and says the two are doing just fine.

"King is like me; he's really strong," she shares. "If he wants something, he'll demand it. He has really good common sense, and I see that in myself. He likes to figure out things."

As for Dream, she describes her as "a really, really happy baby."

And when it comes to having kids, Chyna isn't done yet.

"I wanna have maybe like two more," she shares. "I wouldn't mind having four; I think four is a good number. No more after that. Five is too many. I'd have to get a minivan for sure, and I'm not riding in no minivan."

WATCH: Blac Chyna Is 'Devastated' Over Rob Kardashian's Alleged 'Revenge Porn' -- 'I Felt Betrayed'

Despite the restraining order, Chyna plans to share custody of Dream with Kardashian. In ET's exclusive interview with her attorney, Lisa Bloom, Bloom noted that her client isn't worried about Kardashian's parenting skills.



"Chyna is not concerned about Dream being around Rob," Bloom said. "She has said he's a good father, there are nannies around when the baby is with him and she hasn't had any reason to be concerned. We did not ask for the baby to be part of the restraining order… We just want him to stay away from her and to stop cyberbullying her."

Watch below:
title: Blac Chyna Describes Her Ideal Partner After Rob Kardashian Drama: I Want a 'Confident' and 'Healthy' Man
